p.s: The excerpt from chapter 5 of the novel The Great Gatsby, written by F. Scott Fitzgerald and published in 1925 addresses the climax of the story.
Because it is the middle of the novel and Gatsby has already archievedachieved his dream and happiness, it leads to think that it might not end well for him.
The reunion of Gatsby and his former lover Daisy.
Gatsby, who constantly tries to impress Daisy, arranges a meeting with her at Nick's house.
When Daisy arrives, Gatsby and Nick are already at his house.
After a polite smalltalk amongst friends, Nick and Daisy enter and Nick notices that Gatsby is gone.
Right after, Gatsby stands at the door as if he had just arrived.
Daisy's and Gatsby's reunion seems, according to Nick, awkward and tense at first and it is made clear, that Gatsby had thought about her more than she has about him.
Nick tries to leave the situation but Gatsby leaves with him to tell him about him regretting the meeting.
When Nick convinces him to go back inside, he finds them, after having been gone himself for a while, sitting together happily, all tension gone.
Gatsby wants him and Daisy to come over to his house.
